question: If A is true and B is false, which of the following expressions evaluates to false?
Which number comes next in the sequence: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10?
If all dogs are mammals and all mammals are animals, then which statement is true?
choices: C. Some animals are not mammals.

question: Which shape has exactly three sides?
If x is an even number, then which expression must be odd?
What is the next letter in this sequence: A, E, I, O?
If it is raining, then the ground will be wet. It is raining. Which conclusion follows?
choices: A. The ground is not wet.
C. It will start raining again.

question: What is the next number in this pattern: 3, 6, 12, 24?
Which of the following is not a prime number?
If all birds have feathers, and penguins are birds, then which statement is true?
choices: A. Penguins do not have feathers.
C. All animals with feathers are birds.
D. Penguins can swim better than eagles.

question: Which letter comes next in this sequence: H, E, L, P, O?
If x is even and y is odd, then which expression must be even?
What is the next letter in this sequence: B, C, E, H?
If all humans are mortal and Socrates is a human, then which statement is true?
choices: A. Socrates cannot be a human.

question: Which shape has exactly five sides?
If it is sunny, then the ground will be dry. The ground is wet. Which conclusion follows?
choices: A. It must have been raining.
B. It must not have been sunny.
C. There was a sprinkler system activated.
D. None of the above necessarily follow.
